Vector¶

geoville_storage_gate.vector.create_by_group(geodataframe, ncdf_path, group, attributes)¶

Writes a geodataframe into a new netcdf file. The group defines the file-intern data structure.

Parameters

  • geodataframe – Geodataframe that should get written into the netcdf

  • ncdf_path – path to a netcdf file

  • group – netcdf group name

  • attributes – dictionary including all metadata

geoville_storage_gate.vector.crop_to_bounds(geodataframe, bounds)¶

Crops a geodataframe to the given polygon bounds

Parameters

  • geodataframe – Geodataframe

  • bounds – boundary (shapely.geometry.polygon.Polygon)

Returns

Geodataframe cut to the given bounds

geoville_storage_gate.vector.read_by_attribute(ncdf_path, characteristic, characteristic_value, query='=')¶

Reads a vector (subset) within the given netcdf file by querying a specific characteristic / vector attribute. For example: characteristic_value=5000, characteristic=”area”, query=’>’ will give you all features with the characteristic ‘area’ being bigger than (>) the characteristic_value 5000.

Parameters

  • ncdf_path – path to a netcdf file

  • characteristic – desired column name / vector attribute

  • characteristic_value – desired value for the query

  • query – The relation between the characteristic and the characteristic_value. The available query options are: >, <, >=, <=, =

Returns

vector subset in form of a geodataframe

geoville_storage_gate.vector.read_by_bounds(ncdf_path, bounds, characteristics=None, relation_to_bounds='within')¶
Reads a vector (subset) within the given netcdf file. The bounds and the

characteristics define the file-intern data structure.

Parameters

  • ncdf_path – path to a netcdf file

  • bounds – boundary (shapely.geometry.polygon.Polygon)

  • characteristics – list of desired column names / vector attributes

  • relation_to_bounds – spatial relation between the the geodataframe and the bounds (geodataframe ‘within’ bounds). Choose between: ‘within’, ‘contains’, ‘intersects’, ‘disjoint’, ‘touches’, ‘crosses’, ‘overlaps’, ‘covers’

Returns

vector subset in form of a geodataframe

geoville_storage_gate.vector.read_by_group(ncdf_path, group, characteristics=None)¶
Reads a vector (subset) within the given netcdf file. The group and the

characteristics define the file-intern data structure.

Parameters

  • ncdf_path – path to a netcdf file

  • group – netcdf group name

  • characteristics – list of desired column names / vector attributes

Returns

vector subset in form of a geodataframe

geoville_storage_gate.vector.update_by_attribute(ncdf_path, characteristic, characteristic_value, updated_characteristic, updated_value, query='=')¶

Updates all geodataframe features who’s characteristic matches the characteristic value according to the query operator with the update_value. For example: characteristic_value=5000, characteristic=”area”, query=’>’, update_value=0 will update all features with the characteristic ‘area’ being bigger than (>) the characteristic_value 5000 with the new value 0.

Parameters

  • ncdf_path – path to a netcdf file

  • characteristic – desired column name / vector attribute

  • characteristic_value – desired value for the query

  • updated_characteristic – characteristic that should get updated

  • updated_value – new value for the updated_characteristic

  • query – The relation between the characteristic and the characteristic_value. The available query options are: >, <, >=, <=, =

geoville_storage_gate.vector.update_existing_vector_features(ncdf_path, geodataframe, group)¶

This function compares a geodataframe with a netcdf group containing vector attributes in form of netCDF variables. All geometries that already exist will get updated while the remaining features will be returned as a geodataframe

Parameters

  • ncdf_path – path to the netcdf file

  • geodataframe – GeoDataFrame

  • group – netCDF group name

Returns

geodataframe without the features that got updated

geoville_storage_gate.vector.upsert_by_bounds(geodataframe, ncdf_path, bounds, relation_to_bounds='within')¶

Adds all geodataframe features in relation to the bounds into an existing netcdf file. The bounds also define in which file-intern data structure (groups) the data will be stored.

Parameters

  • geodataframe – Geodataframe that should get written into the netcdf

  • ncdf_path – path to a netcdf file

  • bounds – boundary (shapely.geometry.polygon.Polygon)

  • relation_to_bounds – spatial relation between the the geodataframe and the bounds (geodataframe ‘within’ bounds). Choose between: ‘within’, ‘contains’, ‘intersects’, ‘disjoint’, ‘touches’, ‘crosses’, ‘overlaps’, ‘covers’

geoville_storage_gate.vector.upsert_by_geodataframe(geodataframe, ncdf_path)¶

Writes all geodataframe features into an existing netcdf file. The outer bounds of the geodataframe define in which file-intern data structure (groups) the data will be stored.

Parameters

  • geodataframe – Geodataframe that should get written into the netcdf

  • ncdf_path – path to a netcdf file

geoville_storage_gate.vector.upsert_by_group(geodataframe, ncdf_path, group, attributes=None)¶

Adds a geodataframe into an existing netcdf file. The group defines the file-intern data structure.

Parameters

  • geodataframe – Geodataframe that should get written into the netcdf

  • ncdf_path – path to a netcdf file

  • group – netcdf group name

  • attributes – dictionary including all metadata
